page.title: 11Rayleigh Mount
page.content: We were concerned about the{pollution} in the moat. "Swein" built Rayleigh Mount and he was mentioned in the first Domesday Book.(*notes end of line). We nearly caught a chill*Going up the steep hill*On Rayleigh Mount*We had to count*All the petrol stations and dentists along the way*Dirty old mattress*And a broken brolly*Split {dustbin bags}*And a shopping trolly*Rusty old springs*All covered in slime*Shattered{old clock}that can't tell the time*Stinky and boggy*And squelshy like fudge*Ten million insects*At home in the sludge*.END In the moat there was a crate*Complete with a broken plate* When my Lord Swein was there it was clean*Like a sunbeam*There was a trolley*A balloon and a broken dolly* Something else as well*And now{the} {moat doth smell* } END.
